archetype_name: Family Low-Fat Mediterranean Light Plates (15–30, Mild)
name: Skillet Lemon Chicken Bites with Roasted Green Beans and Brown Basmati
description: Quick lemon-oregano chicken bites with a light pan sauce, served over brown basmati with roasted green beans. Family-friendly, mild, and low in fat with whole-grain fiber.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice until water runs clear.
Measure 3 cups vegetable stock (reserve an extra 2 tbsp separately).
Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a sheet pan.
Zest and juice 1 lemon (keep zest and juice separate).
Mince 2 cloves garlic; chop 1/4 cup parsley.
Remove chicken kebabs from skewers; pat dry. Toss with oregano, half the lemon zest, black pepper, and half the salt.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Combine rinsed brown basmati rice with 3 cups vegetable stock in a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes until tender. Rest covered off heat.
Roast beans: Toss green beans with 1 tsp olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper on the sheet pan. Roast 10–12 minutes until crisp-tender.
Sear chicken: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high. Add remaining olive oil (2 tsp). Add seasoned chicken pieces in a single layer; cook 5–7 minutes, turning once, until cooked through.
Make pan sauce: Reduce heat to medium. Add minced garlic; stir 30 seconds. Add lemon juice and 2 tbsp vegetable stock; scrape up browned bits and simmer 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Finish and serve: Fluff rice with remaining lemon zest and parsley. Plate rice, top with chicken and spoon over pan sauce. Serve roasted green beans on the side.
